event.title: was platted by the Western Town Lot Company in 1880

data.event: The city was platted by the Western Town Lot Company in 1880, and originally named Nordland, with the platted streets given Norwegian names.

event.title: was renamed a few years later

data.event: The city was renamed a few years later, and in 1885 given the name of Arlington, after the colonial center in Virginia.
The city was renamed a few years later, and in 1885 given the name of Arlington, after the colonial center in Virginia.

event.title: were not renamed until several decades

data.event: (It was briefly named Denver in the interlude, but postal authorities did not approve of the name.) The streets were not renamed until several decades passed, with Olaf Street eventually changed to Main Street, Kanut Street to Third Street, etc.
